Greetings to Indian President
articles.content:
Greetings to Indian President
    Pyongyang, January 25 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, on Jan. 23 sent a message of greetings to A.P.J. Abdul Kalam, president of India, on the occasion of the day of the Republic of India.
 Expressing the belief that the traditional friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would continue to grow strong in the common interests of the two peoples, the message sincerely wished him greater success in his responsible work.

articles.title: Message of Greetings to Indian Prime Minister
articles.content:
Message of Greetings to Indian Prime Minister
    Pyongyang, January 25 (KCNA) -- Pak Pong Ju, premier of the DPRK Cabinet, sent a message of greetings to Atal Bihari Vajpayee, prime minister of India, on the day of the Republic of India.
 Expressing the belief that the traditional friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would steadily expand and develop, the message wholeheartedly wished him greater success in his work to build new independent and prospering India.    
 Foreign Minister Paek Nam Sun also sent a message of greetings to his Indian counterpart Yashwant Sinha.

Egyptian Preparatory Committee Formed
articles.content:
Egyptian Preparatory Committee Formed
    Pyongyang, January 24 (KCNA) -- The Egyptian Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea formed a preparatory committee for celebrating the sun of the 21st century on Jan. 17.
 Yehia Zakaria Khairallah, chairman of the committee, was elected chairman of the preparatory committee. 
 A resolution released by the committee stressed that leader Kim Jong Il is the sun of the 21st century who is leading the Korean revolution and the cause of global independence to victory and said that it would conduct a solidarity movement supporting the Korean people's efforts to build a great prosperous powerful socialist nation and reunify the country under his Songun readership.    
 The committee set a period of celebrating the sun of the 21st century from February to April and decided to organize political, cultural and other colorful functions during the period.
